message:
Hi all,

When dealing with a story where the main character (+ Resolve = Change) is the protagonist, I find it very easy to conceptualise the story as the Main Character links in with the OS through the Crucial Element.  The MC changes, and thereby the OS is impacted directly through this change.

How does it work if the Main Character is not the Protagonist.  What links his/her growth to the OS through line?  For e.g. Shawshank Redemption.  Red is the MC, but it is Andy Dufresne  who drives the story.

Red is a change character - but I was wondering if there was an appreciation the links in directly with the O.S. and somehow shapes that?  Or does it need to?

Or is it related to the role they play in the O.S. (e.g. Sidekick or variation thereof)

Their Unique Ability is another way of tying them into the OS. Red shares the same problematic element that everyone in the story deals with - albeit from a different perspective (more personal). That would be the Crucial Element. Note that in the case of Shawshank the OS is resolved long before the MC throughline is resolved.
